bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 50 (Friday, March 17, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. MOULTON:H.R. 1647.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:Salem Maritime National Historic Site renaming and boundarystudy.[Page H1295]

item.title: Salem Maritime National Historical Park Redesignation and Boundary Study Act

latestAction.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on National Parks. Hearings held.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Lands.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text:
Salem Maritime National Historical Park Redesignation and Boundary Study Act

This bill redesignates the Salem Maritime National Historic Site in Massachusetts as the Salem Maritime National Historical Park and directs the Department of the Interior to conduct a boundary study and report to Congress.

Such study shall be to evaluate the suitability and feasibility of including in the National Park System, as part of the Salem Maritime National Historical Park, sites and resources in the study area associated with its maritime history, coastal defenses, and military history.

bill.title: Salem Maritime National Historical Park Redesignation and Boundary Study Act

item.title: Salem Maritime National Historical Park Redesignation and Boundary Study Act
Salem Maritime National Historical Park Redesignation and Boundary Study Act
To redesignate the Salem Maritime National Historic Site as the "Salem Maritime National Historical Park", and for the purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Lands.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
